TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit VideoRendition extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a object that abstracts media rendition properties required for playback in the media player.

remarks.para: Each VideoRendition object that is available for playback by the media player is represented by an instance of the object in the renditions collection of the class. For example, to maximize the chances of the video playing across as many devices as possible, a video rendition using H.264 (MP4) and WEBM container should be specified in the MediaWebPart configuration.

The string corresponding to the codec portion of the HTML5 source tag type attribute.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the codec used by a media rendition.
Docs.value: The string corresponding to the codec portion of the HTML5 source tag type attribute.

remarks.para: This is the value that will only be used by the HTML5 video tag. For example, "avc1.4D401E, mp4a.40.2" for a typical H.264 MP4 and "vp8.0, vorbis" for a typical WebM file.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the label that will distinguish the media rendition from among others on the rendition selection menu.
Docs.value: The string describing a media rendition.

remarks.para: It would be useful to describe the video codec, container, or bitrate.
